James__02.1: My brethren, have not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ of glory <u>with respect of persons</u>.
James__02.2: For if there shall come into your assembly a man having a golden ring, in fine apparel, and there shall come in also a poor man in mean attire,
James__02.3: And you have respect to him that is clothed with the fine apparel, and shall say to him: Sit thou here well; but say to the poor man: Stand thou there, or sit under my footstool:
James__02.4: Do you not judge within yourselves, and are become judges of unjust thoughts?
James__02.5: Hearken, my dearest brethren: hath not God chosen the poor in this world, rich in faith, and heirs of the kingdom which God hath promised to them that love him?
James__02.6: But you have dishonoured the poor man. Do not the rich oppress you by might? and do not they draw you before the judgment seats?
James__02.7: Do not they blaspheme the good name that is invoked upon you?
James__02.8: If then you fulfill the royal law, according to the scriptures, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself; you do well.
James__02.9: But if you have respect to persons, you commit sin, being reproved by the law as transgressors.
James__02.10: And whosoever shall keep the whole law, but offend in one point, is become <u>guilty of all</u>.
James__02.11: For he that said, Thou shalt not commit adultery, said also, Thou shalt not kill. Now if thou do not commit adultery, but shalt kill, thou art become a transgressor of the law.
James__02.12: So speak ye, and so do, as being to be judged by the law of liberty.
James__02.13: For judgment without mercy to him that hath not done mercy. And mercy exalteth itself above judgment.
James__02.14: What shall it profit, my brethren, if a man say he hath faith, but hath not works? Shall faith be able to save him?
James__02.15: And if a brother or sister be naked, and want daily food:
James__02.16: And one of you say to them: Go in peace, be ye warmed and filled; yet give them not those things that are necessary for the body, what shall it profit?
James__02.17: So faith also, if it have not works, is dead in itself.
James__02.18: But some man will say: Thou hast faith, and I have works: shew me thy faith without works; and I will shew thee, by works, my faith.
James__02.19: Thou believest that there is one God. Thou dost well: the devils also believe and tremble.
James__02.20: But wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead?
James__02.21: Was not Abraham our father justified by works, offering up Isaac his son upon the altar?
James__02.22: Seest thou, that faith did co-operate with his works; and by works faith was made perfect?
James__02.23: And the scripture was fulfilled, saying: Abraham believed God, and it was reputed to him to justice, and he was called the friend of God.
James__02.24: Do you see that by works a man is justified; and not by faith only?
James__02.25: And in like manner also Rahab the harlot, was not she justified by works, receiving the messengers, and sending them out another way?
James__02.26: For even as the body without the spirit is dead; so also faith without works is dead.
